citation.article-title: Numerical classification of some Rhodococci, Corynebacteria and related organisms

p.s: Rhodococcus globerulus (glo.be'ru.lus M.L. dim.adj. globerulus globular)
The species description is based on data taken from Goodfellow & Alderson (1977).
On glucose yeast extract agar the primary mycelium soon fragments into rods and cocci.
Colonies are pink to red, rough with entire margins.
Urease positive; allantoinase and benzamidase negative.
Neither adenine nor tyrosine is degraded.

Growth on glycerol, inulin, maltose, trehalose, adipate, malate, pyruvate, sebacic acid and succinate as sole sources of carbon for energy and growth, but not on inositol, rhamnose, salicin, benzamide, p-cresol, m-hydroxybenzoic acid, tartrate or testosterone.
No growth on serine or trimethylenediamine.
The organisms contain mycolic acids (Minnikin & Goodfellow, 1980).
The G + C content is 63 to 67 mol % by Tm for the strains tested (Mordarski et al., 1977).
